sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"获得，取得，得到"之意
sameAnalysis.word_list: acquire, obtain, gain, get, win, earn, secure
means: acquire ：强调通过不断的、持续的努力而获得某物，也指日积月累地渐渐地获得。书面语用词。
obtain ：较正式用词，着重通过巨大努力、要求而得到所需或盼望已久的东西。
gain ：侧重指经过努力或有意识行动而取得某种成就或获得某种利益或好处。
get ：普通用词，使用广泛，可指以任何方式得到某物，也不一定要经过努力。
win ：主要指通过努力、斗争、比赛等而获得胜利。
earn ：侧重指依靠自己的劳动或因付出代价与有功而获得。
secure ：强调要通过努力或竞争，或需要付出代价才能获得所渴望的东西。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均可表示"变成，成为"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: become, get, grow, turn, go, come
means: become ： 最普通用词，作为连系动词，指从一个状态向另一个状态的变化。
get ： 常指某人或某物有意无意地获得引起变化的因素，结果使变成另一状态。
grow ： 常指逐渐地变成新状态，强调渐变的过程。
turn ： 侧重指变得与原来截然不同，有时含贬义。
go ： 作为连系动词，通常与形容词连用，指进入某种状态，从而发生变化，多指不好的状态。
come ： 侧重变化的经过或过程，多用于不良情况。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"带，拿，取"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: bring, carry, take, fetch, get, convey, transport
means: bring ： 指从某处把人或物带到或拿到说话者所在的地点，强调方向，不着重方式。
carry ： 指把物品从一个地方带到另一个地方，不涉及方向，只强调方式。
take ： 指从说话人或说话人心目中所在处把某人或某物带离开，带到离说话者有一定距离的地方，与bring的方向正相反，侧重方向，不着重方式。
fetch ： 指一往一返，相当于go and bring，去取了东西或带人再返回到出发处。
get ： 口语用词，与fetch基本同义，语气随便。
convey ： 指通过中间人传递信息，或以某种方式把人或物送到目的地。
transport ： 指使用车辆或机械设备把人或货物从一处运载到另一处。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"使，使得"之意。
means: make ： 普通用词，指强迫或劝诱他人做某事。
cause ： 正式用词，侧重指使某事发生的原因。
get ： 侧重指劝某人做某事，或指使某事物处于某种状态或产生某种结果。
have ： 普通用词，指让某人做某事。
render ： 书面用词，多指因外界因素而使某人或某物处于某种状态。

entry.def: You use get with adjectives to mean 'become'. For example, if someone gets cold, they become cold, and if they get angry, they become angry.

example.ex: The boys were getting bored...
example.tran: 男孩子们开始感到厌烦。

example.ex: There's no point in getting upset...
example.tran: 苦恼是无谓的。

entry.def: Get is used with expressions referring to states or situations. For example, to get into trouble means to start being in trouble.
entry.tran: （用于表示状况或处境的表达中）陷入，处于

example.ex: Half the pleasure of an evening out is getting ready...
example.tran: 晚上外出时一半的乐趣在于出门前的准备。

example.ex: Perhaps I shouldn't say that — I might get into trouble...
example.tran: 也许我不该讲那些话——我可能会惹来麻烦。

entry.def: To get someone or something into a particular state or situation means to cause them to be in it.
entry.tran: 使陷入，使处于（某种状况或处境）

example.ex: I don't  know if I can get it clean...
example.tran: 我不知道自己是否能把它清理干净。

example.ex: What got me interested was looking at an old New York Times...
example.tran: 我感兴趣的是看一份旧的《纽约时报》。

entry.def: If you get someone to do something, you cause them to do it by asking, persuading, or telling them to do it.

example.ex: ...a long campaign to get US politicians to take the Aids epidemic more seriously...
example.tran: 旨在使美国政界人士更加重视艾滋病流行的长期运动

example.ex: How did you get him to pose for this picture?
example.tran: 你想了什么办法让他摆姿势照了这张照片？

entry.def: If you get something done, you cause it to be done.

example.ex: I might benefit from getting my teeth fixed...
example.tran: 补牙可能对我有好处。

example.ex: It was best to get things done quickly.
example.tran: 最好是赶快把事情弄完。

entry.def: To get somewhere means to move there.

example.ex: I got off the bed and opened the door...
example.tran: 我下床把门打开了。

example.ex: How can I get past her without her seeing me?...
example.tran: 我怎样才能从她身边经过而又不被她发现呢？

entry.def: When you get to a place, you arrive there.

example.ex: Generally I get to work at 9.30am...
example.tran: 我通常上午9点半到单位。

example.ex: It was dark by the time she got home.
example.tran: 她回到家时天已经黑了。

entry.def: To get something or someone into a place or position means to cause them to move there.

example.ex: Mack got his wallet out...
example.tran: 麦克掏出钱包。

example.ex: Go and get your coat on...
example.tran: 去把你的外套穿上。

entry.def: Get is often used in place of 'be' as an auxiliary verb to form passives.
entry.tran: （常用作助动词，代替be构成被动语态）

example.ex: Does she ever get asked for her autograph?...
example.tran: 有人向她索要过签名吗？

example.ex: A pane of glass got broken.
example.tran: 一块玻璃碎了。

entry.def: If you get to do something, you eventually or gradually reach a stage at which you do it.

example.ex: Miller and Ferlinghetti got to be friends...
example.tran: 米勒和费林盖蒂渐渐成了朋友。

example.ex: No one could figure out how he got to be so wealthy.
example.tran: 谁也不知道他怎么会变得如此富有。

entry.def: If you get to do something, you manage to do it or have the opportunity to do it.

example.ex: How do these people get to be the bosses of major companies?...
example.tran: 这些人是怎样成为大公司的老总的？

example.ex: Do you get to see him often?...
example.tran: 你经常能见到他吗？

entry.def: You can use get in expressions like get moving ,get going, and get working when you want to tell people to begin moving, going, or working quickly.
entry.tran: （让…）迅速行动起来/干起来/工作起来

example.ex: I aim to be off the lake before dawn, so let's get moving...
example.tran: 我计划黎明前从湖畔出发，大家马上行动起来吧。

example.ex: We need to get thinking, talking and acting on this before it is too late.
example.tran: 我们得赶紧就此事开动脑筋，展开讨论，并采取行动，否则就来不及了。

entry.def: If you get to a particular stage in your life or in something you are doing, you reach that stage.
entry.tran: 到达（人生、事业的某一阶段）

example.ex: We haven't got to the stage of a full-scale military conflict...
example.tran: 我们还未到全面军事冲突的地步。

example.ex: If she gets that far, Jane may get legal aid to take her case to court...
example.tran: 如果走到那个地步，简也许能得到法律援助去打官司。

entry.def: You can use get to talk about the progress that you are making. For example, if you say that you are getting somewhere, you mean that you are making progress, and if you say that something won't get you anywhere, you mean it will not help you to progress at all.
entry.tran: （用于谈论进展情况）（使…）取得进展/不会有进展

example.ex: Radical factions say the talks are getting nowhere and they want to withdraw...
example.tran: 激进派宣称谈判没有进展，他们打算退出。

example.ex: My perseverance was getting me somewhere.
example.tran: 我锲而不舍，总算有了一些进展。

entry.def: When it gets to a particular time, it is that time. If it is getting towards a particular time, it is approaching that time.

example.ex: It got to after 1am and I was exhausted...
example.tran: 已是凌晨一点多了，我累得筋疲力尽。

example.ex: It was getting towards evening when we got back...
example.tran: 我们回来的时候已经快到晚上了。

entry.def: If something that has continued for some time gets to you, it starts causing you to suffer.

example.ex: That's the first time I lost my cool in 20 years in this job. This whole thing's getting to me.
example.tran: 干这份工作20年来，我头一次失去了冷静，这一切让我大伤脑筋。

entry.def: If something gets you, it annoys you.

example.ex: What gets me is the attitude of so many of the people.
example.tran: 让我恼怒的是这么多人都是这样的态度。

entry.def: If you get something that you want or need, you obtain it.

example.ex: I got a job at the sawmill...
example.tran: 我在锯木厂找了份工作。

example.ex: The problem was how to get enough food to sustain life...
example.tran: 问题在于如何找到足够的食物维持生命。

entry.def: If you get something, you receive it or are given it.

example.ex: I'm  getting a bike for my birthday...
example.tran: 我过生日时会得到一辆自行车。

example.ex: He gets a lot of letters from women...
example.tran: 很多女人给他写信。

entry.def: If you get someone or something, you go and bring them to a particular place.

example.ex: I came down this morning to get the newspaper...
example.tran: 我今天上午过来取报纸。

example.ex: Go and get me a large brandy...
example.tran: 去给我拿一大杯白兰地来。

entry.def: If you get a meal, you prepare it.

example.ex: She was getting breakfast as usual.
example.tran: 她像往常一样在准备早餐。

entry.def: If you get a particular result, you obtain it from some action that you take, or from a calculation or experiment.

example.ex: You could run that race again and get a different result each time...
example.tran: 如果再参加一次那样的赛跑，每次的结果可能都不一样。

example.ex: What do you get if you multiply six by nine?
example.tran: 6乘以9等于多少？

entry.def: If you get a particular price for something that you sell, you obtain that amount of money by selling it.

example.ex: He can't get a good price for his crops.
example.tran: 他的庄稼无法卖个好价钱。

entry.def: If you get the time or opportunity to do something, you have the time or opportunity to do it.

example.ex: You get time to think in prison...
example.tran: 你在监狱里有时间反省。

example.ex: Whenever I get the chance I go to Maxim's for dinner.
example.tran: 我一有机会便去马克西姆餐厅吃饭。

entry.def: If you get an idea, impression, or feeling, you begin to have that idea, impression, or feeling as you learn or understand more about something.
entry.tran: 开始有（想法、印象或感受）

example.ex: I get the feeling that you're  an honest man...
example.tran: 我开始觉得你是个诚实的人。

example.ex: The study is an attempt to get a better idea of why people live where they do...
example.tran: 该研究是为了更好地了解人们选择现在居住地的原因。

entry.def: If you get a feeling or benefit from an activity or experience, the activity or experience gives you that feeling or benefit.

example.ex: Charles got a shock when he saw him...
example.tran: 查尔斯见到他时大吃一惊。

example.ex: She gets enormous pleasure out of working freelance...
example.tran: 做自由职业者让她体会到无穷的快乐。

entry.def: If you get a look, view, or glimpse of something, you manage to see it.

example.ex: Young men climbed on buses and fences to get a better view...
example.tran: 为了看得更清楚些，年轻人爬上了公共汽车和围墙。

example.ex: Crowds shouted and pushed to get a glimpse of their hero.
example.tran: 为了一睹英雄的风采，人群喊叫着，推搡着。

entry.def: If a place gets a particular type of weather, it has that type of weather.

example.ex: Riyadh got 25 mm of rain in just 12 hours...
example.tran: 利雅得在12小时内降水就达25毫米。

example.ex: Northern Kentucky is likely to get snow mixed with sleet.
example.tran: 肯塔基州北部可能有雨夹雪。

entry.def: If you get a joke or get the point of something that is said, you understand it.
entry.tran: 理解，明白（笑话或所说的话）

example.ex: Did you get that joke, Ann? I'll explain later...
example.tran: 安，听懂那个笑话了吗？我过会儿会解释。

example.ex: You don't  seem to get the point.
example.tran: 你好像没有弄明白。

entry.def: If you get an illness or disease, you become ill with it.

example.ex: When I was five I got measles.
example.tran: 我5岁时出过麻疹。

entry.def: When you get a train, bus, plane, or boat, you leave a place on a particular train, bus, plane, or boat.
entry.tran: 搭乘，乘（火车、公共汽车、飞机或船）

example.ex: It'll be two pounds to get the bus...
example.tran: 乘公共汽车要花两英镑。

example.ex: What time are you getting your train?
example.tran: 你赶几点的火车？

entry.def: If you get a person or animal, you succeed in catching, killing, or hitting them.

example.ex: Take it easy. We've got him. He's not going to kill anyone else.
example.tran: 别担心，我们已经抓住他了，他不会再杀人。

entry.def: If you get a newspaper or magazine, you regularly buy it.

example.ex: We don't get a paper...
example.tran: 我们不买报纸。

example.ex: We already get The Times.
example.tran: 我们已经订了《泰晤士报》。

entry.def: If you can get a particular radio or television channel, you are able to receive broadcasts from it on your radio or television.

example.ex: I only get Channel 7.
example.tran: 我只能收看到第7频道。

entry.def: You can say that something is, for example, as good as you can get to mean that it is as good as it is possible for that thing to be.

example.ex: Consort has a population of 714 and is about as rural and isolated as you can get.
example.tran: 康索特有714名居民，是极其偏僻的乡村地区。

example.ex: ...the diet that is as near to perfect as you can get it.
example.tran: 几乎可以说是最无可挑剔的饮食

entry.def: If you say you can't get away from something or there is no getting away from something, you are emphasizing that it is true, even though people might prefer it not to be true.

example.ex: There is no getting away from the fact that he is on the left of the party.
example.tran: 他属于该党左派的事实无法否认。

entry.def: If you get away from it all, you have a holiday in a place that is very different from where you normally live and work.

example.ex: ...the ravishing island of Ischia, where rich Italians get away from it all.
example.tran: 意大利富人消遣度假的美丽岛屿伊斯基亚

entry.def: Get is used in rude expressions like get stuffed and get lost to express contempt, disagreement, or refusal to do something.
entry.tran: （表示蔑视、不同意或拒绝）滚开，去你的

entry.def: You can say, for example, 'How lucky can you get?' or 'How stupid can you get? ' to show your surprise that anyone could be as lucky or stupid as the person that you are talking about.
entry.tran: 你真是太走运了/你真是蠢得无可救药了

example.ex: I mean, how crazy can you get?
example.tran: 我是说，你真是太疯狂了。

entry.def: If you tell someone where to get off, you tell them in a rather rude way that you are not going to do or agree to what they want.

example.ex: If somebody tried to do that to you, you'd just go right up to them and tell them where to get off.
example.tran: 如果有人想那样对待你，你就直截了当地告诉他们别做梦了。

entry.def: You can use you get instead of 'there is' or 'there are' to say that something exists, happens, or can be experienced.

example.ex: You get a lot of things like that now, don't you...
example.tran: 你现在有很多那样的东西，是吧？

example.ex: That's where you get some differences of opinion.
example.tran: 那就是你们的分歧所在。

means.word_mean: 1. come into the possession of something concrete or abstract;

sentences.sentence: "She got a lot of paintings from her uncle"
"Get permission to take a few days off from work"

means.word_mean: 2. enter or assume a certain state or condition;

sentences.sentence: "He became annoyed when he heard the bad news"

means.word_mean: 3. cause to move; cause to be in a certain position or condition;

sentences.sentence: "He got his squad on the ball"
"This let me in for a big surprise"
"These aspects of civilization do not find expression or receive an interpretation"
"I got nothing but trouble for my good intentions"

means.word_mean: 5. reach a destination; arrive by movement or progress;

sentences.sentence: "She didn't get to Chicago until after midnight"

means.word_mean: 6. go or come after and bring or take back;

sentences.sentence: "Get me those books over there, please"

means.word_mean: 7. of mental or physical states or experiences;
8. take vengeance on or get even;
10. cause to do; cause to act in a specified manner;

sentences.sentence: "The ads induced me to buy a VCR"
"My children finally got me to buy a computer"
"My wife made me buy a new sofa"

means.word_mean: 11. succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase;
12. come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes);

sentences.sentence: "I got funny spots all over my body"

means.word_mean: 13. be stricken by an illness, fall victim to an illness;
14. communicate with a place or person; establish communication with, as if by telephone;

sentences.sentence: "Bill called this number and he got Mary"
"The operator couldn't get Kobe because of the earthquake"
"He made a fool of himself at the meeting"
"Don't make this into a big deal"
"This invention will make you a millionaire"

means.word_mean: 16. move into a desired direction of discourse;
17. grasp with the mind or develop an undersatnding of;

sentences.sentence: "We caught something of his theory in the lecture"

means.word_mean: 19. reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot;

sentences.sentence: "the rock caught her in the back of the head"
"The blow got him in the back"
"The punch caught him in the stomach"
"What do you get when you add up these numbers?"

means.word_mean: 21. acquire as a result of some effort or action;

sentences.sentence: "You cannot get water out of a stone"
"What did you get at the toy store?"
"She didn't get his name when they met the first time"
"She will catch hell for this behavior!"

means.word_mean: 25. receive as a retribution or punishment;
26. leave immediately; used usually in the imperative form;

sentences.sentence: "She got the bus just as it was leaving"
"Her childish behavior really get to me"
"She really caught the spirit of the place in her drawings"
"She got the mood just right in her photographs"

means.word_mean: 31. in baseball: earn or achieve a base by being walked by the pitcher;
33. be a mystery or bewildering to;
34. take the first step or steps in carrying out an action;

sentences.sentence: "Get working as soon as the sun rises!"
"The first tourists began to arrive in Cambodia"
"She suffered a fracture in the accident"
"He had an insulin shock after eating three candy bars"
"She got a bruise on her leg"
"He got his arm broken in the scuffle"
"Men often father children but don't recognize them"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old Norse geta 'obtain, beget, guess'; related to Old English gietan (in begietan 'beget', forgietan 'forget'), from an Indo-European root shared by Latin praeda 'booty, prey', praehendere 'get hold of, seize', and Greek khandanein 'hold, contain, be able'

sentences.en: Merrill Lynch got legal protection for an asset allocation strategy.

sentences.cn: 当董事会迫于股东的压力严格审查续任计划时，那些未得到首肯的高管可能也想换份工作。
sentences.en: As boards scrutinize succession plans in response to shareholder pressure, executives who don't get the nod also may wish to move on.

sentences.cn: 失业是经济上的劫难、心理上的尴尬，并且你知道，失业救济是微乎其微的，而且很难得到。
sentences.en: It is financially terrifying, psychologically embarrassing and you know that support is minimal and extraordinarily hard to get.

sentences.cn: 但在奥斯本的世界里，你最初的本能反应是陷入依赖——永久的依赖之中，如果你能得到的话——一个愿意放任你错误的政府支持你这么做。
sentences.en: But in Osborneland, your first instinct is to fall into dependency—permanent dependency if you can get it—supported by a state only too ready to indulge your falsehood.

sentences.cn: 布鲁克斯女士可能会也可能不会对她的记者是如何得到新闻故事的有所怀疑,但是她没有质疑、不做指示,也没有得到可追踪、有记录的答案。
sentences.en: Ms Brooks may or may not have had suspicions about how her journalists got their stories, but she asked no questions, gave no instructions—nor received traceable, recorded answers.

sentences.cn: 对于 很多人，尤其是那些本人或家人有严重健康问题的人来说，在奥巴马医改之前，他们 得到保险的唯一途径便是找到一份提供医疗保险的工作。
sentences.en: For many people, especially those with serious health condition or family members with serious health conditions,before Obamacare the only way to get insurance was through a job that provided  health insurance.

sentences.cn: 假设你正在像某人倾吐心事，但他们却只是茅于接打电话，而当你寻求她们的关注时，就得到一句“我可以同时做很多事”这样的回复。

sentences.en: Researchers who share get plenty of personal benefits, including more connections with colleagues, improved visibility and increased citations.

sentences.cn: 不要试图要孩子们刻苦学习，取而代之，为何不把重点放到让他们从有意义而又富有成效的活动中得到快乐上？像是制作东西、与他人合作、探讨观点以及解决问题。
